Sentencas: The present computational study investigates the effects of pressure and flow patterns on the electrochemical performance of a repeating unit in the anode-support SOFC stack using a reduced order model previously developed.
Titulo: The performance of syngas-fueled solid oxide fuel cell predicted by a Reduced Order Model (ROM): Pressurization and flow-pattern effects

Sentencas: A unique feature of the present study is that the charge, heat, and mass transport affecting the cell performance has been coupled with the temperature field.
Titulo: The performance of syngas-fueled solid oxide fuel cell predicted by a Reduced Order Model (ROM): Pressurization and flow-pattern effects

Sentencas: The focus of this study is to simulate how the flow patterns and operating pressure in conjunction with temperature field coupling impact the electrochemical performance and chemical reactions within syngas-fueled SOFCs.
Titulo: The performance of syngas-fueled solid oxide fuel cell predicted by a Reduced Order Model (ROM): Pressurization and flow-pattern effects

Sentencas: The simulation results show that the benefits of pressure on power performance do not increase linearly, but with a tapering of performance at higher pressure ranges.
Titulo: The performance of syngas-fueled solid oxide fuel cell predicted by a Reduced Order Model (ROM): Pressurization and flow-pattern effects

Sentencas: This indicates that an intermediate pressure operation may offer a balance between increased performance but higher cost in pressurized systems.
Titulo: The performance of syngas-fueled solid oxide fuel cell predicted by a Reduced Order Model (ROM): Pressurization and flow-pattern effects

Sentencas: The counter-flow design yields a narrower temperature gradient than the co-flow design across the stack, thus leading to a better overall performance.
Titulo: The performance of syngas-fueled solid oxide fuel cell predicted by a Reduced Order Model (ROM): Pressurization and flow-pattern effects

Sentencas: The simulations also find that pressurization significantly promotes the CO direct electro-oxidation and reverse water gas shift reaction simultaneously, thus resulting in higher power density.
Titulo: The performance of syngas-fueled solid oxide fuel cell predicted by a Reduced Order Model (ROM): Pressurization and flow-pattern effects
